derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (denoting an opening up of the sea or land, as in an earthquake): from Latin chasma, from Greek khasma 'gaping hollow'

entry.def: A chasm is a very deep crack in rock, earth, or ice.

entry.tran: (事物或团体间的)显著差距，巨大分歧
entry.def: If you say that there is a chasm between two things or between two groups of people, you mean that there is a very large difference between them.

example.ex: ...the chasm that divides the worlds of university and industry.
example.tran: 将大学和企业两个世界分隔开的鸿沟

example.ex: ...the chasm between rich and poor in America.

means.word_mean: 1. a deep opening in the earth's surface
